name: Auto Scaling & Load Balancing Essentials
description: Flashcards covering EC2 Auto Scaling and Elastic Load Balancing concepts for the AWS Cloud Practitioner exam.

cards.front: A retail company expects unpredictable traffic to its web application during promotional events. Which AWS feature can help ensure application availability while minimizing costs?
cards.back: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling enables dynamic scaling of instances based on demand, ensuring high availability and cost efficiency by adding or removing instances as needed.
cards.example: During a flash sale, Auto Scaling adds 5 EC2 instances to handle the load, and scales back down when traffic normalizes.
cards.subject: Elastic Load Balancer

glossary.definition: Automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances in response to demand.
A virtual server in Amazon's Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).

cards.front: Your application runs on multiple EC2 instances and you're noticing one instance handles more requests than others. Which service can help distribute traffic evenly?
cards.back: Elastic Load Balancing distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances, to ensure no single instance is overwhelmed.
cards.example: A web app with 4 EC2s uses Elastic Load Balancing to route user traffic evenly, reducing response times and downtime.
cards.subject: Elastic Load Balancer

glossary.definition: Automatically distributes traffic across multiple targets in one or more Availability Zones.

cards.front: Youâ€™ve configured an Auto Scaling group with a minimum of 2 instances, a desired capacity of 3, and a maximum of 5. What happens when demand spikes significantly?
cards.back: The Auto Scaling group will add instances up to the maximum of 5 to meet demand, but it will not exceed this limit unless manually reconfigured.
cards.example: If traffic triples suddenly, EC2 Auto Scaling may launch 2 more instances to meet demand, but caps at 5.
cards.subject: Elastic Load Balancer

glossary.definition: The number of EC2 instances that should be running under normal conditions in an Auto Scaling group.

cards.front: An app experiences a steady traffic increase every Monday morning. How can AWS Auto Scaling handle this predictable trend efficiently?
cards.back: Predictive scaling can automatically schedule scaling actions in anticipation of demand based on historical data, ensuring resources are ready ahead of time.
cards.example: Auto Scaling schedules the launch of 3 more instances every Monday at 7 AM before user load increases.
cards.subject: Elastic Load Balancer

glossary.definition: Uses machine learning to schedule capacity ahead of demand.

cards.front: Why is Elastic Load Balancing often paired with EC2 Auto Scaling in high-availability architectures?
cards.back: Because as EC2 Auto Scaling dynamically adds or removes instances, Elastic Load Balancing ensures that incoming traffic is evenly distributed across the currently available instances.
cards.example: As new EC2s are launched during a sale, ELB updates traffic distribution automatically to include them.
cards.subject: Elastic Load Balancer

glossary.definition: System design approach to ensure a service remains operational as demand changes.
